intro: Jatropha hassleriana, commonly known as the Hassler's spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant produces yellow flowers and has distinctive, lobed leaves that are often hairy. It is part of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. Jatropha hassleriana is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
